uniqueRequirements: The test is strictly split into two parts: 10 Traffic Signs and 30 General Knowledge questions
CRITICAL: You must answer ALL 10 traffic sign questions correctly (100%) in Part 1 to proceed; missing even one sign results in automatic failure
You must score at least 80% (24/30) on Part 2 (General Knowledge) to pass
Drivers under 18 are prohibited from using a cell phone in any manner (handheld or hands-free) while driving
New 2025 Law: All passengers (front and back seat) must wear seat belts regardless of age (Christopher King Seat Belt Law)

questions.questionText: Drivers under age 18 may not drive between the hours of ___ and ___ except for specific exceptions like work or school.
questions.explanation: Virginia's curfew for drivers under 18 is from midnight to 4:00 AM.

questions.questionText: For the first year of holding a driver's license, a driver under age 18 may carry how many non-family passengers under age 21?
questions.explanation: During the first year, you are limited to one passenger under age 21 who is not a family member. After one year, this increases to three only under specific conditions.

questions.questionText: If you are under age 21, you can be convicted of illegal consumption of alcohol if your BAC is at least ___ but less than 0.08%.
questions.explanation: Virginia has a 'Zero Tolerance' law. If you are under 21 and drive with a BAC of 0.02% or higher, you can be charged.

questions.questionText: In Virginia, it is illegal for ___ to hold a handheld personal communications device (cell phone) while driving.
questions.explanation: It is illegal for ANY driver to hold a handheld personal communications device while driving in Virginia.

questions.questionText: When you approach a school bus with flashing red lights and an extended stop arm on a public roadway with no median, you must:

answers.text: Slow down and pass with caution
Stop only if you are behind the bus
Stop, regardless of your direction of travel

questions.explanation: You must stop for a stopped school bus with flashing red lights if you are approaching from any direction, unless separated by a physical barrier.

questions.questionText: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in a residential, business, or school zone is:
questions.explanation: The maximum unposted speed limit in residential, business, and school zones is 25 mph.

questions.questionText: When following another vehicle, you should maintain a following distance of at least:
questions.explanation: Virginia recommends using the 3-second rule to ensure a safe following distance under normal dry conditions.

questions.questionText: If you are involved in a crash, you must:

answers.text: Drive home and call the police
Only stop if someone is injured
Leave a note on the nearest pole

questions.explanation: You must stop at the scene, render aid if necessary, and exchange information with the other drivers involved.

questions.questionText: Virginia's 'Move Over' law requires drivers approaching stationary emergency vehicles with flashing lights to:

answers.text: Speed up to clear the area
Change lanes to a lane not adjacent to the vehicle, or slow down if changing lanes is unsafe
Stop in the middle of the road

questions.explanation: Drivers must move over a lane if possible. If unable to change lanes safely, they must proceed with caution and maintain a safe speed.

questions.questionText: You are required to turn on your headlights:

answers.text: When using windshield wipers due to bad weather

questions.explanation: Headlights must be on from sunset to sunrise and whenever you use your windshield wipers due to rain, fog, snow, or sleet.

questions.questionText: The maximum speed limit for a passenger vehicle on a rural interstate highway in Virginia is typically:
questions.explanation: The maximum speed limit on most rural interstate highways in Virginia is 70 mph.

questions.questionText: When driving in fog, you should use:
questions.explanation: Use low-beam headlights in fog, rain, or snow. High beams reflect off the moisture and impair visibility.

questions.questionText: At an intersection without signs or signals, you must yield the right-of-way to:
questions.explanation: At an uncontrolled intersection, yield to the vehicle on your right if you arrive at the same time.

questions.questionText: When entering a roadway from a private driveway, you must:

answers.text: Yield to all traffic and pedestrians on the roadway

questions.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to all vehicles and pedestrians approaching on the public roadway.

questions.questionText: When making a left turn, you must yield to:

answers.text: No one if the light is green

questions.explanation: When turning left, you must wait for a gap in oncoming traffic and yield to pedestrians in the crosswalk.

questions.questionText: Pedestrians have the right-of-way:
questions.explanation: Drivers must yield to pedestrians at all intersections and crosswalks, whether marked or unmarked.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to park within ___ feet of a fire hydrant.
questions.explanation: You may not park within 15 feet of a fire hydrant in Virginia.

questions.questionText: You cannot park within ___ feet of an intersection or crosswalk.
questions.explanation: Parking is prohibited within 20 feet of an intersection or crosswalk.

questions.questionText: When parking on a hill with a curb facing downhill, you should turn your wheels:
questions.explanation: When parking downhill with a curb, turn your front wheels toward the curb (right) so the car rolls into the curb if the brakes fail.

questions.questionText: If your vehicle begins to skid, you should:

answers.text: Take your foot off the gas and steer in the direction you want the front of the car to go

questions.explanation: In a skid, avoid braking. Ease off the accelerator and steer in the direction you want the vehicle to go (steer into the skid).

questions.questionText: You must signal at least ___ feet or ___ seconds before making a turn.
questions.explanation: You should signal at least 3 to 4 seconds, or 100 feet, before you turn.

questions.questionText: Driving on a suspended license for the third time may result in:
questions.explanation: A third conviction for driving on a suspended license can result in a mandatory 10-day jail sentence.

questions.questionText: Children under age ___ must be secured in a rear-facing child safety seat.
questions.explanation: Virginia law requires children to ride in a rear-facing safety seat until they turn 2 years old.

questions.questionText: An eight-sided (octagonal) red sign means:
questions.explanation: The octagon is exclusively used for STOP signs. You must come to a complete stop.

questions.questionText: A triangle pointing downward with a red border means:
questions.explanation: This shape is reserved for Yield signs. Slow down and let other traffic pass.

questions.questionText: A diamond-shaped sign indicates:
questions.explanation: Diamond-shaped signs are warning signs (yellow or orange) alerting you to special conditions or hazards ahead.

questions.questionText: A pennant-shaped sign (sideways triangle) on the left side of the road means:
questions.explanation: The pennant shape is used exclusively to mark the start of a No Passing Zone.

questions.questionText: A round yellow sign with an 'X' and 'RR' means:
questions.explanation: This circular sign gives advance warning of a railroad crossing.

questions.questionText: A vertical rectangular sign with a white background usually indicates:
questions.explanation: Vertical rectangles are regulatory signs that inform you of traffic laws (e.g., Speed Limit, Keep Right).

questions.questionText: A pentagon (5-sided) sign indicates:
questions.explanation: The pentagon shape is reserved for school zones and school crossings.

questions.questionText: Orange signs are used for:
questions.explanation: Orange is the standard color for work zone and construction safety signs.

questions.questionText: A sign showing a red circle with a slash through a picture means:
questions.explanation: The red circle with a slash is the universal symbol for 'No' (e.g., No U-Turn).

questions.questionText: A green sign with white letters indicates:
questions.explanation: Green signs are guide signs that provide directional information.

questions.questionText: If you drive an uninsured vehicle in Virginia, you must:

answers.text: You cannot drive; insurance is mandatory as of July 2024

questions.explanation: Effective July 1, 2024, the option to pay the Uninsured Motor Vehicle Fee was repealed. All vehicles must be insured.

questions.questionText: In Virginia, U-turns are allowed:

answers.text: At intersections unless a sign prohibits it

questions.explanation: U-turns are generally permitted at intersections unless a 'No U-Turn' sign is posted. They are illegal on curves or where visibility is limited.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a deer symbol means:
questions.explanation: This warning sign indicates that deer are known to cross the road in this area.

questions.questionText: A sign with two arrows pointing up and down indicates:
questions.explanation: This warning sign tells you that you are leaving a one-way street and entering a two-way street.

questions.questionText: To avoid drowsy driving, you should:

answers.text: Drive faster to finish the trip
Open the windows and play loud music
Get plenty of sleep before driving and take breaks

questions.explanation: The only effective way to prevent drowsy driving is getting quality sleep and taking regular breaks.

questions.questionText: A blue sign with a large 'H' means:
questions.explanation: Blue signs are for services; 'H' stands for Hospital.

questions.questionText: Refusing a breath test (Implied Consent) results in an automatic license suspension for:
questions.explanation: Refusing a breath test results in an immediate 7-day administrative suspension, followed by a potential 1-year suspension if convicted.

questions.questionText: When parking next to a curb, your tires must be within ___ of the curb.
questions.explanation: You must park within one foot (12 inches) of the curb.

questions.questionText: A sign with a truck on a slope means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a steep hill ahead; check brakes.

questions.questionText: When a traffic signal is not working (blacked out), you should:

answers.text: Go if the road is clear

questions.explanation: A malfunctioning traffic light must be treated as a four-way stop.

questions.questionText: Antilock Braking Systems (ABS) allow you to:
questions.explanation: ABS prevents wheel lockup, allowing you to maintain steering control while braking heavily.

questions.questionText: The speed limit in a school zone is usually:
questions.explanation: The maximum speed limit in school zones is 25 mph unless posted otherwise.

questions.questionText: A sign with a bicycle symbol means:
questions.explanation: This warning sign indicates a bicycle crossing or bike lane is ahead.

questions.questionText: When merging onto a highway, you should:

answers.text: Stop at the end of the ramp
Adjust speed to match traffic and merge when safe

questions.explanation: Use the acceleration lane to match the speed of highway traffic before merging.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to transport children under age ___ in the bed of a pickup truck.
questions.explanation: No one under age 16 may be transported in the open bed of a truck.

questions.questionText: Funeral processions have the right-of-way. You should:

answers.text: Yield and let the entire procession pass

questions.explanation: Do not cut through or interfere with a funeral procession; they have the right of way.

questions.questionText: Aggressive driving conviction remains on your record for:
questions.explanation: Aggressive driving stays on your driving record for 5 years.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a 'T' intersection symbol means:

answers.text: Road ends ahead, turn left or right

questions.explanation: The T-intersection sign warns that the road you are on ends and you must turn.

questions.questionText: When driving in snow, you should:

answers.text: Slow down and increase following distance

questions.explanation: In snow, slow down and increase space to stop safely without skidding.

questions.questionText: Passing is prohibited:

answers.text: On hills, curves, and at intersections

questions.explanation: You may not pass where visibility is limited, such as hills, curves, or intersections.

questions.questionText: A sign with a wheelchair symbol indicates:
questions.explanation: This sign reserves parking spaces for vehicles with disabled permits.

questions.questionText: You are approaching a roundabout. You must:

answers.text: Yield to traffic already in the circle

questions.explanation: Vehicles entering a roundabout must yield to traffic already circulating.

questions.questionText: If a tire blows out, you should:

answers.text: Grip the wheel firmly and ease off the gas

questions.explanation: Do not brake. Hold the wheel firmly to maintain control and slow down gradually.

questions.questionText: The speed limit for passenger cars on interstate highways in designated areas can be as high as:
questions.explanation: 70 mph is the maximum speed limit on certain rural interstates in Virginia.

questions.questionText: A sign with a flagger symbol means:
questions.explanation: This orange sign warns of a flagger controlling traffic in a work zone.

questions.questionText: Driving 20 mph or more above the speed limit is:
questions.explanation: Driving 20+ mph over the limit (or over 85 mph total) is Reckless Driving, a criminal misdemeanor in VA.

questions.questionText: You may pass on the right if:

answers.text: The vehicle ahead is turning left and there is room on the pavement

questions.explanation: You may pass on the right if the vehicle ahead is turning left and the way is clear on the pavement.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a cross (+) means:
questions.explanation: The cross symbol warns of a 4-way intersection ahead.

questions.questionText: When stopping behind another vehicle, you should be able to see:

answers.text: Their rear tires touching the pavement

questions.explanation: Leave enough space to see where the rear tires of the car ahead touch the road.

questions.questionText: If you arrive at a 4-way stop at the same time as another driver:

answers.text: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right
The driver on the right yields

questions.explanation: At a 4-way stop, yield to the vehicle on your right if you arrive simultaneously.

questions.questionText: Parking is illegal:
questions.explanation: Parking is prohibited in all these locations.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Keep Right' and an arrow around a divider:

answers.text: Keep to the right of the obstruction

questions.explanation: This regulatory sign tells you to drive to the right of a traffic island or median.

questions.questionText: Bicycles on the roadway:

answers.text: Are considered vehicles and have the same rights/duties

questions.explanation: Bicycles are vehicles in Virginia and must follow the same traffic laws.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Low Clearance 12 ft 6 in' warns of:

answers.text: A low bridge or underpass ahead

questions.explanation: This sign warns that overhead clearance is limited.

questions.questionText: If a deer jumps out in front of you:

answers.text: Brake firmly and stay in your lane

questions.explanation: Do not swerve; brake firmly. Hitting the deer is safer than hitting a tree or another car.

questions.questionText: A DUI conviction (1st offense) results in a license suspension of:
questions.explanation: A first DUI offense carries a mandatory 1-year license revocation.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a winding arrow means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a series of curves or a winding road ahead.

questions.questionText: You must dim your high beams when within ___ feet of an oncoming vehicle.
questions.explanation: Dim high beams within 500 feet of oncoming traffic.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'No Turn on Red' means:

answers.text: You must wait for green to turn

questions.explanation: This regulatory sign prohibits turning right on a red light.

questions.questionText: The safest place for a child in a vehicle is:

answers.text: The center of the back seat

questions.explanation: The center rear seat is statistically the safest location for a child.

questions.questionText: When entering an interstate, who has the right of way?
questions.explanation: You must yield to traffic already on the interstate.

questions.questionText: Brown signs point to:
questions.explanation: Brown signs indicate parks, museums, and historical sites.

questions.questionText: When checking mirrors, you should see:

answers.text: The road behind you and a small part of your vehicle

questions.explanation: Adjust mirrors to see the road behind and just a sliver of your vehicle's side.

questions.questionText: How many demerit points are assigned for a DUI?
questions.explanation: DUI carries a 6-point demerit penalty.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Lane Ends' indicates:
questions.explanation: Lane Ends means the lane you are in is ending and you must merge.

questions.questionText: The 'two-second rule' refers to:
questions.explanation: Use 2 seconds for speeds under 35 mph; 3 seconds for 35-45 mph.

questions.questionText: Can you park in a bicycle lane?
questions.explanation: Parking in a bicycle lane is prohibited.

questions.questionText: A sign with a '+ ' symbol means:
questions.explanation: The cross symbol warns of an intersection ahead.

questions.questionText: When is it legal to exceed the speed limit?
questions.explanation: It is never legal to exceed the posted speed limit.

questions.questionText: If your brakes fail:

answers.text: Pump the brake pedal and use the parking brake

questions.explanation: Pump brakes to build pressure, then use the parking brake carefully.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Do Not Pass' means:

answers.text: You are in a no passing zone

questions.explanation: This regulatory sign prohibits passing.

questions.questionText: Virginia law requires you to notify the DMV of an address change within:
questions.explanation: You must notify DMV within 30 days of moving.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Speed Limit 55':
questions.explanation: Black and white speed limit signs show the maximum legal speed.

questions.questionText: When pedestrians are in a crosswalk, you must:
questions.explanation: You must yield to pedestrians in crosswalks.

questions.questionText: If you drive while your license is suspended, your vehicle may be impounded for:
questions.explanation: Driving on a suspended license can result in vehicle impoundment for up to 30 days.

questions.questionText: When passing a cyclist, allow at least ___ of clearance.
questions.explanation: Allow at least 3 feet of space when passing a bicyclist.

questions.questionText: A sign with a curved arrow and 'Only':

answers.text: You must turn in direction of arrow

questions.explanation: Lane use control signs marked 'Only' require you to turn.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to hold a child on your lap while driving:

answers.text: Unless you are in back seat

questions.explanation: Holding a child on your lap is dangerous and illegal.

questions.questionText: The biggest cause of crashes in work zones is:
questions.explanation: Distracted driving and speeding are top causes of work zone crashes.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Yield Ahead' means:

answers.text: Slow down and prepare to yield

questions.explanation: Advance warning that a Yield sign is ahead.

questions.questionText: Using a fake ID to buy alcohol results in:

answers.text: License suspension for up to 1 year

questions.explanation: Use of a fake ID results in license suspension and fines.

questions.questionText: When waiting to turn left, keep your wheels:
questions.explanation: Keep wheels straight so if hit from behind, you aren't pushed into oncoming traffic.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Thru Traffic Keep Left' means:

answers.text: Through traffic should stay in left lane

questions.explanation: Directs through traffic to maintain the left lane.

questions.questionText: A solid yellow line on your side means:
questions.explanation: Solid yellow lines prohibit passing.

questions.questionText: When backing up, you should:

answers.text: Turn your head and look out the rear window

questions.explanation: Physically turn and look to check blind spots while backing.

questions.questionText: A sign with a 'Soft Shoulder' text means:

answers.text: Shoulder is unpaved/soft, do not drive on it

questions.explanation: Warns of soft ground on the shoulder.

questions.questionText: Double parking is:
questions.explanation: Parking beside another parked vehicle (double parking) is illegal.

questions.questionText: Drivers over 21 are DUI if BAC is:
questions.explanation: Legal limit for adults is 0.08%.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'One Way' arrow:

answers.text: Traffic flows only in direction of arrow

questions.explanation: Traffic flows only in the indicated direction.

questions.questionText: If a vehicle is tailgating you:

answers.text: Slow down or move to another lane to let them pass

questions.explanation: Let tailgaters pass safely.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'No Parking Any Time':
questions.explanation: Strict prohibition on parking.

questions.questionText: When is the road most slippery?
questions.explanation: Oil mixes with water initially, making roads slickest when rain starts.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Emergency Stopping Only':
questions.explanation: Shoulder use is restricted to emergencies.

questions.questionText: When backing out of a driveway:
questions.explanation: Yield to everyone when entering the road.

questions.questionText: Cruise control should not be used:

answers.text: On slippery roads or in traffic

questions.explanation: Cruise control can cause loss of control on slick surfaces.

questions.questionText: Failure to pay child support can result in:
questions.explanation: License can be suspended for non-payment of child support.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Detour' arrow:
questions.explanation: Orange sign guiding traffic around a closure.

questions.questionText: You must dim high beams when following within ___ feet.
questions.explanation: Dim high beams when following within 200 feet.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Bridge Ices Before Road':
questions.explanation: Bridges freeze first; proceed with caution.

questions.questionText: Most crashes are caused by:
questions.explanation: Driver error causes the majority of crashes.

questions.questionText: Can you park next to a yellow curb?
questions.explanation: Yellow curbs generally indicate no parking zones.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Signal Ahead':
questions.explanation: Warns of a traffic light ahead.

questions.questionText: Broken white lines mean:

answers.text: Separate lanes going same direction, passing allowed

questions.explanation: Broken white lines separate same-direction traffic and allow lane changes.

questions.questionText: When a traffic light turns green:
questions.explanation: Ensure intersection is clear before proceeding.

questions.questionText: When passing a truck, do not:
questions.explanation: Avoid staying in the truck's blind spots (No-Zones).

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Bump' means:
questions.explanation: Warns of a bump in the road; slow down.

questions.questionText: A first time offense of driving without a license is a:
questions.explanation: Driving without a valid license is a Class 2 misdemeanor.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Dip' means:
questions.explanation: Warns of a depression or dip in the road.

questions.questionText: Who must wear seat belts in the front seat?
questions.explanation: Front seat occupants must wear seat belts.

questions.questionText: If a vehicle passes you, you should:
questions.explanation: Allow the vehicle to pass safely; do not speed up.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Pass With Care':
questions.explanation: Indicates you may pass if safe.

questions.questionText: Can you park in front of a mailbox?
questions.explanation: Do not block access to mailboxes.

questions.questionText: Maximum speed in a business district is:
questions.explanation: Unposted limit is 25 mph.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Median Ahead':
questions.explanation: Warns of a physical divider ahead.

questions.questionText: You should check your exhaust system to prevent:
questions.explanation: Leaks can cause deadly fumes to enter the cabin.

questions.questionText: If an emergency vehicle is stopped with lights flashing:
questions.explanation: Move Over law applies.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Pavement Ends':
questions.explanation: Warns of changing road surface.

questions.questionText: Points stay on your record for:
questions.explanation: Demerit points remain valid for 2 years.

questions.questionText: Passing is allowed on a two-lane road if:
questions.explanation: Broken yellow indicates passing permitted.

questions.questionText: If you are taking medication:
questions.explanation: Know how meds affect driving before getting behind wheel.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'School Bus Stop Ahead':
questions.explanation: Warns of school bus activity.

questions.questionText: Can you park on a crosswalk?
questions.explanation: Parking on a crosswalk is illegal.

questions.questionText: Radar detectors are:
questions.explanation: Radar detectors are illegal in VA.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Reduced Speed Ahead':
questions.explanation: Warns of lower speed limit zone ahead.

questions.questionText: To steer straight while backing:
questions.explanation: Look back and hold wheel to control direction.

questions.questionText: Yield signs mean:

answers.text: Slow down and be ready to stop

questions.explanation: Yield means give way to traffic.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'No Hitchhiking':
questions.explanation: Prohibits soliciting rides.

questions.questionText: Driving without liability insurance is:
questions.explanation: Insurance is mandatory; the uninsured fee option was repealed.

questions.questionText: Use low gears when:
questions.explanation: Engine braking helps control speed on downgrades.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Center Lane' and arrows:
questions.explanation: Center lane is shared for turns.

questions.questionText: The speed limit in a parking lot is usually:
questions.explanation: Drive slowly in lots; standard is low.

questions.questionText: You must yield to blind pedestrians with:
questions.explanation: Yield to white canes/guide dogs.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Low Shoulder':
questions.explanation: Warns of elevation difference between road and shoulder.

questions.questionText: If you miss your exit:
questions.explanation: Never back up on highway.

questions.questionText: Littering is:
questions.explanation: Littering is illegal.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'No Outlet':
questions.explanation: Road does not connect to another.

questions.questionText: When turning right on red:
questions.explanation: Full stop required before turning right on red.
